item.title: Distributing Commercial Software Through Container Images
item.description: When delivering software to clients, many independent software vendors (ISVs) still rely on methods involving ZIP or JAR files, binaries, MSIs, APT and RPM packages, and make install scripts. These distribution approaches are often client and machine-specific, requiring ISVs to spend precious time on tailoring software delivery rather than feature development. Containerization simplifies software delivery, which ISVs should take advantage of and focus on selling software as container images. To satisfy ISVs requirements and clients' expectations for automation, customer access and self-service, the choice of a container registry that meets ISVs requirements is crucial.
